The Binding of Isaac is a really deep game when it comes to item synergies and what feels like millions of possible builds. Each item you pick up has the potential to change the way you play, like one might replace your regular tears with lazers or one makes you throw up big green explosive bombs, that do very high damage, but can also damage you, giving you a high risk, high reward play style. With around 700 different types of items to pick up and use, it offers a lot of variety to play with. 

And the game offers many different types of characters to play as, all with a unique and distinct play styles. One might be all about getting hit on purpose to build up damage for the remaining floor you are in while one is the complete opposite, and only gives you one hit before you go down, with the upside of flight and tears that can travel through rocks and obstacles, as well as an unique dice item, giving you a potential re roll of the item you might not wanna take, with the downside of it sometimes deleting the item. Its like gambling in a way, you will do that a lot in the game. Take risks that pay off, but also might backfire on you

What i also like is the way achivements are tied to actual useful things. Each achivement you gain actually unlocks something new for you to find, like a new character, new floors, new paths to take and most importantly, new item unlocks. The achivement system is a good way to keep track off, what you might need to unlock next. 

The one small negative i have to give is the game its the type of game you need a friend or a youtube guide to understand what to even do to unlock certain bosses or items. Its very cryptic and confusing if you dont understand it, but once you know, its easy to hop into the game and plan ahead where you want to go in your run, which boss you are working towards and so on.

Overall a highly recommended game, if you still are unsure if you like it, buy the regular game game Rebirth without the dlc, try it out and if you like it, buy all the dlc. (small warning, you might have problems with converting the save from the rebirth to newest repentance + DLC, so if you want to avoid it, you could also just buy everything all at once. Its worth it and you get 200+ hours out of it)

10/10
Would get just Rebirth then get DLC's when you like it and REP+ is free and does QoL changes and Co-op

Ended up buying this game for myself after buying the first Binding of Issac and Rebirth for my partner as these were some of his favorite games. He ended up getting me interested in these games as well and I bought this one and all dlc so I could play online and its honestly been fun with repentance plus! Would recommend for just base game alone as you can do local multiplayer and have fun that way (though it is different without dlc), but dlc is constantly being fixed and updated along with repentance plus. Nothing is ever really the same between runs and as you play more, you get more characters you can unlock to change up the gameplay that much more and even cool challenges you can try by yourself or with friends. Be warned there's still issues with lag on online lobbies with repentance plus, but it is constantly getting better in my experiences so far.

While this game is fun, its just not AS fun as many of the other games in its genre. The animations and everything about the game are just fine! fun to look at even. There were however some mechanics to the game that I just didn't enjoy. The turds were too tough. The 'upgrades' were not very substantial sometimes. And acquiring a build was entirely left to RNG. I 'beat the game' after a matter of 3 hours but that was only because I got a couple of ridiculously strong upgrades that just happened to synergize.  The lack of a choice make the only way to play just blasting through as fast as you can to acquire some kind of wild build that actually works and dying about 50 times before each good run. Again, a decent entry into the genre and fun artwork but I prefer a game that has more strategy and choice involved in my runs. I'm sad to give it a 6/10.

One of the games that will forever remain a mystery to me. No matter how many times I try, I just cannot get into it. The items seem to be luck-based more than anything; and I understand there are ways to take advantage of the tarot cards/dice in order to reroll and stuff, but that aspect just isn't fun to me. Most of the game's mechanics require the Wiki, and even then, there are too many secrets that you would have no knowledge of without watching a Youtube video or reading up somewhere. Actually engaging with just the game itself is impossible for me; the gameplay loop is constantly interrupted with reading.
This game goes from a simple fun game to an absolute grindfest where you'll blink and two days will have passed. Recommend 10/10

short_description: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth is a randomly generated action RPG shooter with heavy Rogue-like elements. Following Isaac on his journey players will find bizarre treasures that change Isaac’s form giving him super human abilities and enabling him to fight off droves of mysterious creatures, discover secrets and fight his way to safety.
